Text:
As the sun begins to set, Iris and Cid return to the
Crimson Order headquarters.
Phew...
Are you tired?
Yes...a little.

You look more than "a little" tired to me. Well, I'm
probably ten times more tired thanâ€”

What sharp eyes you have. I didn't mean to let it
show in my face.

(All that walking in an unfamiliar place, with all
those curious stares... I didn't realize it sooner,
but I must be more exhausted than I thought.)

(In other words, this proves just how sheltered I've
been from the outside world as royalty. And the
one who helped me realize this is...)
I will make tea.
You'll do it yourself, Princess?
That's my intention, yes.
But couldn't your maid or servantâ€”

Heehee! You spent the whole day with me. At least let
me thank you by making you a cup of tea.
Urk... Okay, then...thanks!

Phew... I do love tea. Though it does embarrass me
a little to have you see me in such a disheveled
state.

Oh, it's okay...don't mind me. Just pretend I'm
a rock on the edge of the road.

Heehee! My, you say such amusing things sometimes.
Anyway, once again, let me say...
Cid... Thank you for everything you've done today.

You helped me discover my own shortcomings, you
helped me see things from new perspectives...it was
a very meaningful day.
Ohhh! Well, in that case...I'm glad to hear it. Yup.

This morning, I had no idea that I would learn so
many things.

I'd just had this vague idea that if I visited the
same places you went with my sister, I could
find some clues on how to rekindle my
relationship with her.
And did you find those clues?
...I am not sure.
Huh?

I think my problem goes deeper...than needing to
repair a broken relationship.
Really?

Yes... I wanted to learn about Alexia herself, of
course, but I also wanted to know what she was
thinking. So I thought I could borrow her friendâ€”
you, Cidâ€”to help me.

And I chose you...because I had the feeling that in
a way, you might know Alexia much better than I did.

And just as I'd hopedâ€”no, even more soâ€”I got the
results I wanted.
You had a rather strange reaction, considering...
Well, that's because...

Because I became painfully aware of my
narrowmindedness...and my shortcomings.

Under those conditions, there was no way
I could let myself rejoice.
Is that how it works?
Yes, it is.

Alexia aside, I never even realized just how
difficult it was for people of different classes
to be friends. How they would be judged or
perceived by others.

I never understood how to interact with other people.
Not in my official duties, but how to interact with
friends...how to act around them out in town...

How could Iâ€”with these shortcomingsâ€”have possibly
understood Alexia?

She just might have a much broader perspective and
a more realistic way of thinking than I.

Um! I don't! Think that! At all! I don't think that's
it at all!
Heehee! You are too kind.

Well, you might not want my opinion, but...maybe this
was a good thing for you?
It was...a good thing?

If what happened today helped you realize what your
problem is, all you have to do now is fix it.

Besides, I think not understanding Alexia is a very
normal thing.
What do you mean by that?

Well, take my sister for example...I have absolutely,
totally, not a shred of an idea what she's thinking.
You have...no idea?
None! Nadda! Zilch! I know nothing!

But, well...I can't help it. My sister and I are
different people. Everything about us is
different.

But I sense a very deep bond between you Kagenou
siblings.

Isn't it because you both have a deep understanding
of each other?

I think you're wayyyy off there... But we're still
brother and sister. That'll never change.

We may not understand each other's thoughts, but...
I guess we're probably connected on some other level.

Cid takes a sip of tea. His candid words make Iris
smile softly.

(Connected on some other level... Is that how Alexia
and I are?)

So, do you think it's all right if I don't understand
what she's thinking?

Nobody can ever really know what anyone else is
thinking anyway. Not without a mind-reading spell,
that is.

A mind-reading spell...well, I have yet to master
that.

If you royals could use mind-reading spells, you'd be
fearless.

Yes, indeed. It is a power that all the powerful and
royal people of the world covet.

Cid's lighthearted conversation lightened the burden
in her heart. Even without a mind-reading spell, Iris
could now understand why her sister liked to be around
him.

Cid, it seems what is on Alexia's mind is not the
thing I should have been concerning myself with.

I need to come to terms with myself... And think hard
about all the knowledge I've gained today.

Woo-hoo! I'm glad you reached a conclusion! I guess
my work here is done!

Heehee! Oh, Cid, what a silly joke. Do you make jokes
to lighten the mood?
Huh?!

Please, I would appreciate it if you continued to
teach me more about Alexia.

Whaaat?! Um, excuuuse me? But I thought...you were
gonna drop that?

I have dropped the idea of trying to understand
exactly what is on her mind.

But I have an innocent curiosity. I want to know what
she's like at school, or when she's walking around
town incognito.

W-Well...wouldn't you normally ask a knight or
someone who's good at that kind of job toâ€”

I mean, yeah! If you'd just done that from the very
start, I wouldn't have needed to even... Urrrg!
Damn you, Claire!

Also, even though things didn't go so well this time,
next time, I will come prepared. I really would like
to have a proper incognito walk through town.

And when that time comes, Cid...if you could help me,
I would appreciate it.

Does this mean...you want...to go on a walk...through
town with me...again?
Yes! That is what I mean.
Her bluntness makes Cid's face freeze.
Will you help me, Cid?
Y-Yes, I'd love to...help you out...hahaha...

Heehee! I am glad you accepted my request! Well, once
I know the date and time, I will contact you.

Princess Iris Midgar means no harm. She doesn't mean
to intimidate him either. She just...doesn't have a clue.

She doesn't notice the twitching in Cid's smile, or
the fact that he can't refuse her because of his
sister. She just simply doesn't have a clue...
